intro: Mentha macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a serrated margin. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, producing small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Mentha macrostachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks.
